executive_summary: Revenue for the Packaging and Labeling Services industry fluctuates with consumer spending, as service providers earn most of their revenue from contract package and labeling services provided to fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) and pharmaceutical product manufacturers. As US consumption has risen for most of the period, manufacturers have expanded production, increasing the number of products that need to be packaged and thus boosting demand for the industry. Overall, industry revenue is anticipated to have increased an annualized 4.4% to $12.7 billion over the past five years. In 2023, revenue is anticipated to rise 3.3%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Consumption of consumer-packaged goods and fast-moving consumer goods has grown
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Contract packaging and labeling service providers depend on demand for manufactured goods that need to be packaged and labeled before being transported to retail destinations or consumers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Packaging and Labeling Service providers' essential position in packaging and distributing COVID-19-related drug trials has bolstered the industry's performance.
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Demand for consumer essentials, pharmaceuticals and, food products grew in 2020 as consumers increasingly ate at home during COVID-19.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Ready-to-eat meals are becoming increasingly popular
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Ready-to-eat meals are becoming increasingly popular as people seek ways to save time and energy. Fast-moving consumer goods companies have responded to this trend by developing a variety of ready-to-eat meals that are convenient and affordable, driving industry demand.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Increased Regulations from the Pharmaceutical Sector Will Continue to Lift Demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The packaging-related regulations associated with the continued implementation of the Drug Supply Chain Security Act (DSCSA) will drive more drug manufacturers to outsource.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: E-COMMERCE SELLERS WILL NEED PACKAGING AND LABELING SERVICE PROVIDERS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Companies that will primarily sell online are going to have high packaging needs. These companies are likely to minimize their physical footprints to enhance their profit margins, which means that they will often turn to contract packaging services. This will enable them to limit the use of their facilities to core operating activities.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: COMPETITION IN THE PACKAGING AND LABELING SERVICES INDUSTRY WILL INTENSIFY
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: IBISWorld expects industry competition to increase as some packaging manufacturers expand their operations to include packaging and labeling services or industry companies integrate supply chain services to serve as turnkey-service providers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: I N T E L L I G E N T  P A C K A G I N G  W I L L  B E  T H E  F U T U R E
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The integration of technology and packaging will likely continue to evolve. Intelligent packaging solutions, like sensors, indicators and temperature-sensitive labels, will enable real-time product freshness, quality and safety monitoring, enhancing supply chain visibility, reducing product spoilage and improving consumer confidence.

industry_definition: Industry operators primarily package client-owned materials on a contract or outsource basis and provide labeling and imprinting package services. The industry excludes activity related to the manufacture of packaging or labeling products.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level low - steady

threats: Demand from cosmetic and beauty products manufacturing

key_trends: COVID-19-related drug trials brought much-needed demand for packaging and labeling services.
E-commerce sellers use contract packaging services as they seek to minimize costs. Rising e-commerce sales bolster demand for packaging and labeling services.
Changes in FDA regulations stimulate demand for packaging and labeling services.
Demand from cosmetics and beauty manufacturers is often dependent on consumer sentiment. Falling consumer sentiment in 2023 is expected to hamper industry performance.

Rising snack food consumption has stimulated additional demand for packaging and labeling services. Snack food companies' efforts to convey the quality and uniqueness of their products through packaging benefits the industry.

Stringent regulations guide pharmaceutical product manufacturers to industry operators. Increasingly strict regulations for pharmaceutical products result in manufacturers outsourcing packaging and labeling services.
Packaging and labeling service providers set up shop in proximity to downstream markets.
Packaging and labeling providers that cater to pharmaceutical manufacturers require different facility infrastructure than a company that caters to natural food producers.
The capabilities of large package manufacturing companies pose a threat to the industry.
High purchase costs inhibit more significant profit growth.
Automation has played an increasing role in the industry in recent years.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Food and beverage producers are responsible for converting raw ingredients and materials into finished food and beverage products. These products are then distributed to consumers through various channels like supermarkets.

market_segmentation.segment: Cosmetic and personal care product producers
market_segmentation.segment_description: The personal care and cosmetics manufacturers market comprises consumer goods producers operating in the personal care and cosmetics manufacturing markets. Products requiring packaging include lipstick, mascara, skin cleansers, lotions, shampoo, hair styling products, perfumes and colognes. Companies producing these products often use contract packaging at a greater rate since most are small manufacturers and do not have the necessary packaging capabilities.

Companies that manufacture hardware are involved in the conception, creation and supply of tangible hardware components and goods for usage in computing, electronics and many other sectors. Hardware products often require various packaging because of the variety of consumer channels, like standalone products in retail stores or as part of a larger product kit. Hardware manufacturers endure strong price competition from domestic and foreign producers, making supply chain efficiency and cost minimization critical to success.

Apparel and textile producers are involved in the manufacturing and producing of clothing, textiles and related products. Much of the revenue from this market is derived from folding and display preparation for packed materials. The US market for apparel manufacturers has diminished over the long-term by competition from foreign companies. Many smaller operations require industry services to fulfill orders as they grow their brand.

Other clients include manufacturers of electronics, pet supplies, toys and games, office products, hard goods and other soft goods. Demand for pet supplies has surged as consumers increasingly view pets as part of the family and lavishly spend on pet accessories and toys. The surge in remote employment and digital education has significantly helped manufacturers of electronic commodities. Products like laptops, webcams and numerous other tools that promote virtual communication and joint effort have witnessed an elevated demand, boosting demand for the Packaging and Labeling Services industry.

Pharmaceutical and medical product manufacturers produce pharmaceuticals, medications, medical devices and other healthcare-related products. These are vital within the healthcare industry. Pharmaceutical and other medical products must be packaged according to strict sterilization and regulatory standards; accordingly, the Packaging and Labeling Services industry labels these products with various mandatory information, including precautions, dosages, and ingredients. Industry operators contributed to the packaging and labeling of COVID-19 drug trials and distribution.

products_and_services.product_description: This segment provides packaging services for manufacturers and distributors in various markets, including cosmetics, pharmaceuticals, foodstuffs, toys, home and garden décor, sporting goods and small hardware. The functions of this service extend to external package labeling services, which encompass coding, marking and internal labeling.

In addition to traditional packaging services, the industry provides support services for its clients that are not necessarily considered industry-relevant. This includes support in packaging design, testing, re-packaging, logistical services and warehousing.

Assembly and fulfillment services include any production done by industry operators with the finished client-owned products. Assembly activities for industry operators include folding textiles and arranging products for display and package size optimization. Assembly and fulfillment services have risen because of COVID-19 and the surge in e-commerce sales.

tier_1_suppliers: Forklift & Conveyor Manufacturing in the US
Cardboard Box & Container Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Plastic Bottle Manufacturing in the US
Glass Product Manufacturing in the US
Metal Can & Container Manufacturing in the US
Dye & Pigment Manufacturing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Packaging & Labeling Services in the US
tier_2_buyers: Brand Name Pharmaceutical Manufacturing in the US
Cosmetic & Beauty Products Manufacturing in the US
Supermarkets & Grocery Stores in the US
Auto Parts Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Packaging and Labeling Services are the Primary Source of Demand
demand_determinants.determinant_description: This segment provides packaging services for manufacturers and distributors in various markets, including cosmetics, pharmaceuticals, foodstuffs, toys, home and garden décor, sporting goods and hardware.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Growth in E-Commerce Sales Bolsters Assembly and Fulfillment Services
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Assembly and fulfillment services include any production done by industry operators with the finished client-owned products. Assembly activities for industry operators include folding textiles and arranging products for display and package size optimization. Assembly and fulfillment services have risen because of COVID-19 and the surge in e-commerce sales.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: The Industry Satisfactorily Provides Many Other Services
demand_determinants.determinant_description: In addition to traditional packaging services, the industry provides support services for its clients that are not necessarily considered industry-relevant. This includes support in packaging design, testing, re-packaging, logistical services and warehousing.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region has the highest percentage of both establishments (around 35%) and population (around 30%), indicating a high concentration of businesses and population in this area.

regulations_points.regulation_title: The Fair Packaging and Labeling Act (FPLA)
regulations_points.regulation_description: The FPLA and other federal/state laws govern labeling requirements for consumer products.
The FDA administers food and pharmaceutical regulations and packaging/labeling requirements.
The FSMA outlines requirements for food packaging that went into effect in 2016-2018.

regulations_points.regulation_title: The Drug Quality and Security Act (DQSA)
regulations_points.regulation_description: The DQSA outlines creating an electronic system to identify and trace certain prescription drugs.

basis_points.basis_title: Packaging and labeling providers require different facility infrastructure
basis_points.basis_description: Packaging and labeling providers that cater to pharmaceutical manufacturers require different facility infrastructure than a company that caters to natural food producers.

basis_points.basis_title: Large package manufacturing companies pose a threat
basis_points.basis_description: The capabilities of large package manufacturing companies pose a threat to the industry.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Small, regional companies dominate the industry
concentration_points.concentration_description: Small, regional companies that specialize in specific packaging and labeling functions dominate the industry.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Small- and medium-sized operators focus on local producers
concentration_points.concentration_description: Small- and medium-sized operators focus on maintaining service contracts with local producers, while large operators rely on close relationships with a few major clients as the main source of revenue.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Specialized packaging and labeling needs cause increased fragmentation
concentration_points.concentration_description: Specialized packaging and labeling needs have caused increased fragmentation in the industry. Customers frequently require specialized packaging and labeling services tailored specifically to their products.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Costs associated with purchasing packaging and labeling are high
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Costs associated with purchasing packaging and labeling are high because of the high cost of raw materials like plastic resins, steel, aluminum, recovered paper and paperboard.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Packaging and labeling is not capitally intensive
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Packaging and labeling is not capitally intensive and does not rely heavily on expensive equipment.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Low rate of new patent technologies
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low, which limits the potential for innovations.
The concentration of technologies is high in this industry, suggesting exposure to unforeseen areas of innovation.
Major market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified, suggesting limited entry points.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Industry tied to retail and consumer industries
volatility_points.volatility_description: Companies are dependent on the retail and consumer industries, which fluctuate due to economic conditions and consumer demand.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Small company size contributes to volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: Many companies rely on a few clients for most revenue, so losing a major client causes significant revenue loss.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Packaging and Labeling Services are Primary Source of Demand
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: This segment provides packaging services for various markets like cosmetics, pharmaceuticals, foodstuffs, toys, home/garden decor, sporting goods and hardware.
This service includes coding, marking and internal labeling.
Demand for consumer products represents the largest downstream demand for packaging services.
The industry's involvement in COVID-19 drug trials contributed to rising packaging/labeling demand.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Growth in E-Commerce Sales Bolsters Assembly and Fulfillment Services
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Assembly and fulfillment services have risen due to COVID-19 and the surge in e-commerce sales.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in a niche service or bundle its services to attract clients?
FAQs.answer: Several industry operators may only work in the medical and pharmaceutical space while others cater their services to a wide variety of product manufacturers.

FAQs.question: How do you market your services to potential clients? Is there a heavy reliance on long-term contracts or repeat clients?
FAQs.answer: The majority of operators rely on a few clients for a large portion of revenue. Therefore, they rely on these as repeat clients or suffer significant losses in revenue, increasing volatility.

FAQs.question: Does your business need to be located near key consumer or client markets?
FAQs.answer: Distribution of industry establishments generally follows the distribution of manufacturing establishments, since industry operators that locate themselves near clients gain advantages in transportation costs.

FAQs.question: Does your company target a particular market segment or provide for a broad range of markets? How important is building or maintaining relationships with packaging suppliers?
FAQs.answer: Some companies will target really specific markets while others cater to a wide variety.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce costs through automation?
FAQs.answer: Some industry operators purchase the latest technology and equipment to provide more automated services, while some rely more on human capital.

FAQs.question: Does your business use web-based systems for customer bookings or orders?
FAQs.answer: By providing convenient platforms for customers to place orders or receive customer support, an operator may be able to differentiate itself. Reputation and quality of service are a primary basis for competition.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure the health and safety of its employees?
FAQs.answer: Health and safety laws differ depending on the location of an operator and also may differ depending on the type of markets they service.

FAQs.question: Do regulations pertinent to your business vary from state to state? Have new laws relating to pharmaceutical labeling requirements affected your operations? Have these laws resulted in necessary investments in new technology or equipment?
FAQs.answer: Several regulations such as the Food Safety Modernization Act and the Drug Quality and Security act are at the federal levels. However, the implementation of these, as well as other regulations, vary from state to state. Recently, requirements for content and label traceability in the pharmaceutical industry have risen.

FAQs.question: How frequently does your company purchase new equipment?
FAQs.answer: Some companies focus on having the latest technology while that may not be as central to the strategy of another company.

FAQs.question: How dependent is your company on borrowed finances?
FAQs.answer: For high investment purchases such as new equipment and facility space. This likely increases for company's that are expanding or acquiring other companies.

FAQs.question: What shares of your workforce accounts for part-time contract workers and full-time employees, respectively?
FAQs.answer: Companies in the industry need to have a multiskilled labor force capable of highly specialized tasks. Industry operators with more contract staff are better able to ramp up labor in response to high demand.

FAQs.question: How many clients does your company have? What are the costs of servicing a range of clients? Is your client mix spread across a variety of industries or concentrated among a few?
FAQs.answer: Successful industry operators will be flexible and able to offer services to clients across various industries. However, some may choose to specialize in serving specific industries that might have highly specific requirements, such as pharmaceutical packaging and labeling.

FAQs.question: What measures do you have in place to reduce operational costs? Are you considering any new cost-saving measures?
FAQs.answer: Successful industry operators must manage costs to maximize their generally small profit margins.

FAQs.question: How have fluctuations in corporate profit affected your business in the past? How do you manage operations during periods of lower corporate profit?
FAQs.answer: During periods of higher profit, businesses are more likely to purchase industry services to fulfill their packaging needs. Corporate profit is estimated to rise in 2021, benefiting the industry.

FAQs.question: How does consumer spending affect demand from your customers? Do you closely track consumer spending?
FAQs.answer: Higher consumer spending directly affects the number of goods that manufacturers need to package to sell. Industry operators act as a key cog in the supply chain between manufacturers and consumers. Consumer spending is anticipated to rise in 2021, benefiting industry operators.

FAQs.question: How do you plan to take advantage of an increase in e-commerce sales? What custom packaging design services do you offer? Do you have or plan on creating an online order platform for clients?
FAQs.answer: In general, higher reliance on e-commerce tends to reduce the amount of physical locations that companies maintain as they seek to compete for higher-margin online sales. As a result, these companies are more likely to outsource packaging and labeling services.
